title: When I save a bookmark the name field is the link rather than the page name
content: My computer recently did an update and since then every time I save a bookmark it's displayed as the link to the page, which is not especially useful for me. I typically save bookmarks by highlighting the link in the search field and dragging it to where I want it, as I have so many bookmarks that simply saving it is far too inconvenient. Is there a way I can change it so that when I save it my usual way it will show as the page name rather than the link? I tried going into troubleshoot mode and the issue still happened, so I'm fairly certain the problem isn't any of my extensions.

title: An error occurred during a connection to lh3.google.com.
content:
since a few days I cannot download photos to my laptop from Google photos secure connection failed is the error I'm seeing I have tried everything getting error message secure connection failed Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to lh3.google.com. • The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified. • Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem. Learn more... Try Again


since new update firefox 111 and update windows 11 cannot download photos from google photos to my laptop tried security.ssl.enable_ocsp_stapling setting in firefox changing from true to false. didn't work tries disabling extensions in firefox -didn't work tried in private window firefox - didn't work tried with different browser- micrsoft edge- didn't work

tried when nordvpn was paused : didn't work checked updates on all network adaptors

made exclusion from scanning 

https://lh3.google.com/   in kasperky internet security - didnt work

The only thing I have not tried is changing DNS server setting, I don't have enough knowledge to start doing this.

title: Win 10 Browser Freezes on Amazon and Netflix
content:
For reasons I have been unable to determine, FireFox is partially loading Amazon and Netflix and freezing. The mouse will work on closing the browser but will not click on videos or reload the tab. It's inconsistent. Sometimes working without a problem. Sometimes freezing when I first switch on the computer. I've tried everything. System maintenance doesn't help. FireFox uses so much memory, it's difficult at times to get into the Task Manager to assess what's going on.

(Memory note. This computer is primarily used for Amazon Prime, Netflix and YouTube. Sometimes Peacock.)

Trying to sync potentially added a glitch where I can no longer delete history and have to manually delete. (When I found it the other computer, it said/showed it had been clearing history. But I had manually delete several months.)

Refreshing has no effect.

I tried to uninstall and reinstall but it reinstalled the exact same set-up without a few pinned links on the new window start up page.
